How to write a CV

Introduction

A CV is a relevant summary of your education, skills and experience and is used by employers to assess your suitability for the role. There is no definitive way to write a CV but follow some basic rules and your CV is more likely to make a positive impact.

On average, an employer will spend just 30 seconds on your CV – very little time for you to grab their attention.

General tips

  • Tailor your CV to the organisation.
  • Prioritise the most relevant, important information.
  • Avoid lengthy prose – use a snappy, concise style with emphasis on ‘action’ words.
  • Check spelling, grammar and punctuation.
  • Make sure you tailor your CV for each role you are applying for.
